title: Lynmar 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This delicious appellation wine is a tremendous testament to all it has to offer, from juicy strawberry and blueberry fruit to savory edges of black tea and cardamom. It excels in its depth of evolved flavor and complex balance and approachability.

title: Lynmar 2016 Summit Block Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine has an ethereal quality to it, buoyed by thickets of bright citrus, pomegranate and strawberry. Full bodied, it retains a heightened grip of acidity that remains beneath earthy characteristics of forest floor and clove.

title: Melville 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Red cherry, dried rose petal and cinnamon-spiced melon show on the unique and alluring nose in this bottling. The palate offers a complex blend of earth and fruit, combining sour cherry with wild thyme, red flowers and dried sage.

title: Pali 2016 Huber Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From a vineyard planted in 1986, this twist-top bottling is fresh and lovely, starting with aromas of grapefruit pith, nectarine, Pink Lady apple, orange and chalky minerality. The sip is bright, energetic and snaps with flavors of tangerine, chilled peach and light hazelnut, all wrapped in citrusy freshness and taut tension.

title: Pascal Jolivet 2016 Indigène  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: As the name suggests, this wine is made using natural yeasts. It comes from a parcel in the small village of Tracy, close to the Loire river. The wine is ripe and full of fruit, with a tangy, orange-zest aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Pflüger 2016 Dürkheimer Spielberg Trocken Riesling (Pfalz)
description: Dry in style yet luscious and ripe, this full-bodied Riesling offers layers of juicy grapefruit and yellow peach flavors. It's creamy and rounded on the palate yet balanced by smoke, slate and crushed mineral as well as zesty lemon-lime acidity. The finish lingers on notes of peach and apricot. Enjoy now through 2024.

title: Quinta de Roriz 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This finely perfumed wine has ripe tannins and rich fruit. It is full of berry flavors, supported by a dry structure and acidity, all well packaged into a complex texture that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2028.

title: Quinta do Passadouro 2016 Passadouro Vintage  (Port)
description: The wine is floral with great fruit that is tending to dominate the essential tannins. That suggests a wine that will be drinkable earlier rather than later. It is certainly an attractive wine in a fruity way—ripe potentially sweet. Drink this wine from 2027.

title: Quinta Santa Eufemia 2016 Casa Santa Eufêmia Vintage  (Port)
description: Perfumed and structured, the wine sums up the quality of this ripe vintage. It is a drier style but its tannins are generous while also firm. This is a wine that will come together into a rich, luscious Port. Drink from 2028

title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2016 Talentus Vintage  (Port)
description: Packed with tannins, this is fully structured wine. Its dark texture and sweet berry fruits are cut with acidity and still touched by the spirit. It is sure to come together well to give a wine that is rich, fruity and structured for the long term. Drink from 2029.

title: Richard Böcking 2015 M Schlossberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: This sprightly medium-sweet Riesling bolts and darts on the palate with penetrating flavors of sweet tangerine, lemon and honey. It's such a zesty wine, yet is intensely juicy and fruity, too. A dense backbone of crushed slate and stone lends complexity and verve to the finish.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Grande Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Farmed by the grande dame Dorothy Rossi, this wine opens with a touch of matchstick reduction and smoky wood. Rustic, concentrated layers of leather, tobacco and crushed rock provide a savory core of depth and complexity, buoyed by a richness of graham cracker and blackberry jam.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2013 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: Extremely concentrated, flavorful and full bodied, this brawny wine has an inky dark color, exotic aromas of cedar, clove and blackberry followed by dense, ripe fruit flavors and mouth-coating tannins. It will be fun to drink soon with a fatty chop or steak but will easily age and improve through at least 2023.

title: Ryan Cochrane 2016 Solomon Hills Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Steely on the nose, this always impressive bottling by a San Francisco accountant-turned-winemaker shows delicate aromas of lime blossom, chalk, sea salt, Asian pear and blanched almond. There is a tense grip to the palate and laser-sharp acidity, delivering flavors of lime sorbet and nectarine with a flash of light marshmallow on the deep finish.

title: Serge Dagueneau et Filles 2016 La Léontine  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Named after grandmother Léontine, this wine is made to be aged. It is still maturing, hinting at fullness to come. Spice and generous apple flavors are cut with acidity and a rich texture. As the develops further, it will fill out and become more powerful. Drink from 2019.

title: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2016 Rosso  (Etna)
description: Star anise, violet, crushed herb and Mediterranean brush aromas align with a whiff of crushed stone. It's silky smooth, offering juicy raspberry, wild strawberry, dark spice and white pepper framed in lithe, polished tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance while a flinty mineral note energizes the finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Townley 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Perfumed and floral in rose petal, this is a soft, supple and plush red with ample acidity to support and complement the texture. Strawberry, rhubarb, clove and black tea are met by a rewarding dash of white pepper.

title: Trapiche 2014 Terroir Series Finca Coletto Single Vineyard El Parel Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: The stout, concentrated nose is packed with berry fruit but also shows a slightly wild side that's rustic and suggestive of animal hide. The acidity is a bit bracing, carrying flavors of dark plum, currant and blackberry. Jam and chocolate finish with mellow tannins. Drink through 2022.
designation: Terroir Series Finca Coletto Single Vineyard El Parel

title: Vermeil 2015 XXXIV Frediani Vineyard Red (Calistoga)
description: This blends 35% Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Cabernet Franc, 23% Zinfandel and 14% Petite Sirah. Together, they harmonize into one whole of broad, leathery and complex texture and flavor. There's both softness and grip beneath the dark-black fruit and peppery spice.

title: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin 2008 La Grande Dame Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: Veuve Clicquot's prestige cuvée is a ripe, mature wine. With toastiness coming from soft fruit and a rich textured character, it is a classic of this producer's ripe style. The wine's acidity and crisp edge make a good contrast to the full-bodied character. Drink now.
